title: Tommy Fury declares he wants eight kids with Molly-Mae Hague and they're trying every night
text:

Tommy Fury jokingly declared he wants eight children with girlfriend Molly-Mae Hague - and that they're trying for babies almost every single night.

The Love Island stars dished intimate details about their relationship as they sat down for a question and answer session on Molly's YouTube channel.

And when they were asked if they want to have kids one day, Tommy suggested they'd be ending up with a rather large brood.

"We both definitely want children," Molly tells her fans. "But obviously we're both only 20 years old."

"We've been trying to make children most nights," Tommy jumps in.

Molly protests but Tommy insists they've been trying to get pregnant.

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: Youtube)

He says: "Yes we have, we've been snoodling in the bedroom, I want twins by the time I'm 22, simple as that.

"Molly wants six kids, I want eight."

Molly insists this is "false information" but Tommy keeps it up, asking her why she's lying.

She goes on to say she'd actually like two children and Tommy then says he wants four.

As the video begins, the couple sit tucking into a Nando's, with Tommy complaining his mash is so hot it'll "burn his lips off".

Molly-Mae takes a bite but laughs and spits half of it out onto her leg, and that just sends them into fits of giggles.

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: Youtube)

After taking questions from her fans on Instgram, they sit down to dish the details.

They're asked to divulge the reason behind their biggest argument, but the answer may leave people surprised.

Molly says: "Now honestly, this isn't even a lie, we've not had one argument."

"Literally not one," Tommy adds. "That's what I said, could you even pick one?"

Molly says although she's quite an argumentative person, it doesn't happen with Tommy.

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: Youtube)

She says: "We just constantly laugh. I'm not even just saying this to be like, oh we're the perfect couple, because we're not, but we just don't argue, do we?"

The couple were also asked how often they see each other, given their busy schedules.

But after getting an apartment together, they say they see each other every day and go to bed together every night.

Tommy says: "That's the thing, like most people say Love Island relationships don't last , but there's nothing different from our relationship to another relationship."

(Image: PA)

When asked to reveal the funniest thing that's happened to them since leaving the villa, Molly admits she finds herself in tears of laughter every day.

She says: "Honestly, hand on heart, I cry every single day with laughter. There's not a day that we spend together that I don't cry with laughter.

"Honestly, I know it sounds dead cringey but all we do is laugh and laugh."
